meanings.definition: A person who governs or controls a state or organization.
meanings.sent1: The governor of the state signed the new law.
meanings.sent2: The school governor oversees the educational policies.
meanings.sent3: The governor of the chess club made sure everyone followed the rules.
meanings.sent4: She was the governor of the playground, always deciding the games to play.
meanings.sent5: The governor of the company ensured all employees followed the guidelines.

meanings.definition: A device for controlling the speed of an engine or machine.
meanings.sent1: The car's governor limited its speed to ensure safety.
meanings.sent2: The factory installed a new governor to regulate the machine's output.
meanings.sent3: The governor on the treadmill made sure I didn't run too fast.
meanings.sent4: The governor on the fan kept the room at a constant temperature.
meanings.sent5: The governor on the engine prevented it from overheating.

meanings.definition: A member of a group that oversees the management of an institution or organization.
meanings.sent1: The board appointed a new governor to supervise the finances.
meanings.sent2: The hospital governor ensured the staff followed proper procedures.
meanings.sent3: The governor of the book club organized the reading schedule.
meanings.sent4: She was the governor of the team, always coordinating their efforts.
meanings.sent5: The governor of the committee led the discussions effectively.
